design_intent.player_goal: Covers threat actor attributes/types, motivations, vectors/attack surfaces, and threat intelligence concepts including OSINT, dark web, confidence scoring, STIX/TAXII, and sharing orgs. Objectives: 2.1: Compare and contrast common threat actors and motivations.; 2.2: Explain common threat vectors and attack surfaces.; 2.3: Explain various types of vulnerabilities (incl. zero-day, supply chain).; 4.3: Explain activities associated with vulnerability management (threat feeds, OSINT, info sharing, dark web). Glossary: Attack surface - Any system/app/service exposure that may contain a vulnerability an attacker can target.; Threat vector - The method/path used to obtain access (email, USB, wireless, supply chain, etc.).; APT - Advanced Persistent Threat: sophisticated, well-resourced, long-duration attacks, often nation-state linked.; Zero-day - A vulnerability unknown to the vendor/defenders at discovery time; no patch exists yet.; STIX - A structured format (objects/relationships) for describing threats so tools can process them consistently.; TAXII - An HTTPS-based protocol used to exchange cyber threat intelligence, often STIX.

mastery_model.update: Mastery += 8 on first correct; +4 on repeat correct; -6 on wrong (floor 0).

missions.name: Profile the Adversary
missions.goal: Threat actor attributes + common actor types + motivations.

coaching_tips: Money-driven? Think organized crime or fraud-first attackers.
Long-term + high resources + stealth? Think nation-state/APT.
Already has access? Always consider insider.

missions.name: Find the Front Door
missions.goal: Threat vectors and attack surfaces used for initial access.

coaching_tips: Attack surface = what can be attacked. Vector = how they get in.
If it’s a USB drop, the vector is removable media even if payload is a file.
Physical access turns “hard” attacks into “easy” attacks.

missions.name: Threat Intel Without Losing Your Mind
missions.goal: Threat feeds, OSINT/dark web, confidence scoring, STIX/TAXII, sharing orgs.

coaching_tips: Assess intel with: timely + accurate + relevant.
Confidence scores help you use low-confidence intel carefully, not ignore it.
STIX is the language; TAXII is the delivery truck.
